Bill Venners wrote:
 
> A agree he should present the information architecture 
> through hypertext, but it need not be "instead." It can 
> be in addition to presenting it in the URI. Like it or not, 
> both the hypertext and the URI are part of the user 
> interface of a web application.

That is a key and vital point, and definitely worth repeating.


-- 
-Mike Schinkel 
http://www.mikeschinkel.com/blogs/ 
http://www.welldesignedurls.org/ 
"It never ceases to amaze how many people will proactively debate away
attempts to make the web more usable..."
